translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Kaccāna
The Elder Uruveḷakassapa’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
the sage who knows all the worlds;
A hundred thousand eons from now,
the one with vision will appear.
The one who instructs and teaches,
the star for all living beings;
The Buddha who is skilled in teaching,
he will liberate many people.
The one with compassion and pity,🔽the one who wishes for the welfare of all living beings;
When the ascetics have all arrived,
he will establish them in the five precepts.

original: Evaṁ nirākulaṁ āsi,🔽suññataṁ titthiyehi ca;🔽Vicittaṁ arahantehi,
analyzed: evam nirākulam āsi  suññatam titthiyehi ca  vicittam arahantehi
translated: In this way it will be free of trouble,🔽empty of ascetics;🔽It will be adorned with Worthy Ones,
those who have attained mastery, those who are peaceful.
There will be fifty-eight treasures,
that Great Sage will appear;
He will be golden-colored,
with thirty-two excellent marks.
His lifespan will be a thousand years,
that will be the extent;
While he remains for that long,
he will liberate many people.
At that time, in Haṁsavati,
I was a brahmin who was well-regarded;
I approached the Light of the World
and listened to the teaching of the Dhamma.
At that time, in the great assembly,
in the great assembly of disciples;
Having heard that he was staying on the top of the mountain,
I was delighted.
Having invited the Great Victor,
together with a thousand brahmins,🔽I gave a great gift.
Having given the great gift,
and having worshipped the Leader,

analyzed: eka mantam ṭhitaḥ haṭṭhaḥ  idam vacanam abravi
translated: I stood to one side delighted,🔽and spoke this speech:
‘In you, Hero, I have faith,
and through the virtue of my service,
may there be a great assembly,

analyzed: nibbattassa tahim tahi  tadā avoca parisa  gajagajjitasussaro
translated: wherever I am reborn.’🔽Then the Teacher, with the sweet voice of the elephant’s cry,
with the sound of the cuckoo,🔽said to the assembly:
‘See this brahmin!
Golden-coloured, with mighty arms,
with a lotus-like face and eyes,
delighted, with faith in me,
and with my virtues.
He is aspiring to the position
of the monk Sīhaghosa,
in a future time,
and will fulfil his wish.
After a hundred thousand aeons,

analyzed: okkāka kula sambhavaḥ  gotamaḥ nāma gottena
translated: born into the Okkāka family,🔽he will be a teacher in the world,
known as Gotama by family.
He will be an heir to his (the Buddha’s) Dhamma,
formed from the Dhamma in his heart,
He will be the disciple of the Teacher,
and his name will be Kassapa.
Two and ninety cycles ago,
there was a peerless Teacher,
Without equal, incomparable,
Phussa, the Leader of the world.
Having destroyed all darkness,
having unravelled the great tangle,
He rained down the deathless shower,
satisfying the world and the devas.

analyzed: tadā hi bārāṇasiya  rājā paccā ahumhase
translated: At that time in Bārāṇasī,🔽we were three brothers,
all of us kings,
but we were banished from the kingdom.
We were heroes, handsome and strong,
unconquered in battle,
then the border regions were in revolt,
and the lord of the earth said to us:
‘Go and conquer the border regions,🔽and clear the forest regions,
and having made it safe and secure,

analyzed: puna detha ati bhāsatha  tatas mayam avocumha
translated: return and tell me.’
Then we said: ‘If you will give us a leader,
to attend on us,
we will accomplish your task.’

analyzed: tatas mayam laddha varā  bhūmipālena pesitā
translated: Then we received the boon,🔽and were sent by the lord of the earth,
and having conquered the border regions,
we returned again.
Having asked for the Teacher’s attendance,
To the King, the Leader of the World;
Having obtained the Hero of Sages,
we worshipped him for as long as we lived.
And very expensive clothes,
and excellent flavours,
and delightful resting places,
and beneficial medicines.
Having given to the Sage with the Saṅgha,
which we had prepared for the Dhamma;
Virtuous, compassionate,
with minds intent on development.
Having served with faith,
the Leader with a mind of loving-kindness;
When he had passed away, the Foremost in the World,

analyzed: pūjam katvā yathābala  tatas cutā santusita
translated: having made offerings according to our ability.
Having passed away from there, we went to the Tusita (Heaven),🔽and there we experienced great happiness;
we all experienced (this),
the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Just as a magician on a stage
shows many different forms,
so in the various existences I was wandering,
I was the Lord of Videha.
Through the words of Guṇākara,
I had fallen into wrong views,
and had mounted the path to Hell,
because of my love for my daughter.
Not accepting the advice
of the Brahmā Nārada,
I was reborn in many ways,
and having abandoned my evil views,
Having fulfilled them, in particular,
Having fulfilled the ten courses of action,
I left this body behind,
And went to heaven, to the abode of the gods.
In my last existence,
I was a kinsman of Brahmā;
In the prosperous city of Bārāṇasī,
I was born into a very great family.
Frightened by death, sickness, and old age,
I entered the great forest;
Seeking the state of Nibbāna,
I wandered among the ascetics with matted locks.
At that time, two brothers of mine,
went forth together with me;
Having built an hermitage in Uruvelā,
I dwelt there.
My clan name was Kassapa,
and I was a resident of Uruvelā;
Therefore my designation was
Uruvelakassapa.
My brother in the Nadī region,
was known as Nadīkassapa;
He was known by his dwelling place,
Gayākassapa in Gayā.
Two hundred for the younger brother,
three for the middle brother,
five hundred for me,
all disciples following me.
Then the Buddha, having approached me,
having performed various miracles for me,
the world's foremost, the charioteer of men,🔽tamed me.
With a retinue of a thousand,
I became a monk by the invitation of the Buddha.
Together with all of them,
I attained perfection.
They and many others,
my disciples, surrounded me.
And I was able to teach,
so the seventh of the seers
in a great assembly
placed me in the foremost position.
Oh, the deed I did for the Buddha
has borne fruit for me.
My defilements are burned up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā uruveḷakassapo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmai uruveḷakassapaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Uruvelakassapa recited these verses.
The account of Elder Uruvelakassapa, the eighth, is finished.
